result.execSummary:
The defendant Billy Deandre Tyler Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: *Pay mandatory surcharges in this action as a condition of probation. If not paid a civil judgment to be entered. Court ordered no fines or costs.

*Mental health assessment. Comply with any treatment recommended, including taking of prescribed medications.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Court ordered defendant to serve 4.5 months in the House of Correction, consecutive, with 4 days credit for time served. The Court granted Huber privileges for work, job-seeking, and treatment. 

COURT IMPOSED BUT STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on Probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 1 year with the following conditions:
-No contact with Megan S. or UWM
-40 hours of community service
-Mental health assessment. Comply with any treatment recommended, including taking of prescribed medications.
-No new violations of the law that rise to the level of probable cause.
-Pay mandatory surcharges in this action as a condition of probation.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
Court ordered NO FINES or COSTS.

Filed;
-Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
-Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Defendant Billy Deandre Tyler in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  COURT FINDS DEFENDANT GUILTY as charged in the criminal complaint and enters judgment of conviction.
SUPPLEMENTAL DOCUMENTS ABOUT DEFENDANT'S ARREST AND EXPLANATION OF HIS TRANSPORTATION TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY CRIMINAL JUSTICE FACILITY.

Defendant Billy Deandre Tyler in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defense requests a plea and sentencing date.  Court orders case adjourned to Branch 46.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 31, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Meagan S and UM-Milwaukee Campus

Defendant Billy Deandre Tyler in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Defendant Billy Deandre Tyler in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Branch 46.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 26, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
